definition[0]: an area where the government is encouraging business activity. New businesses there usually pay lower taxes and companies are given money to encourage them to move to the area.
definition[1]: an area which the government is helping by supporting new businesses and encouraging companies to move there by offering money or by allowing them not to pay certain taxes for a period of time
example[0]: The city of Fresnoâ€™s designated enterprise zone includes the downtown area, portions of the airport area, and the large industrial and manufacturing area.
